results.title: Cereal seed disinfection

results.title: Ceramic glazes
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the mixing of an opaque matt and stone glaze, both showing wide firing latitude and high colour receptivity. Glaze application by several methods is shown. Kiln interiors at intervals during firing show the progressive stages of the glaze.

results.title: Ceramic art of Japan
results.creator_credit: Nihon Eiga Shin-sha and Tokyo National Museum
results.brief_description: Ceramics, the traditional art of hands, clay and fire, began with the making of earthenware. Korean and Chinese influences can be traced in the history of Japanese ceramics but were modified by the existing traditions of the Japanese craftsmen. Exquisite work includes some dating from the ninth century, a tenth century jar with a beautiful ash-blown glaze; tea ceremony bowls of porcelain with plum blossom being used as a popular motif.

results.title: Century of progress
results.creator_credit: M. Bhavnani, Documentary Films of India and V.R. Sarma
results.brief_description: A survey of the Indian Railways, the story of the fulfilment of a 100-year-old dream. April 16, 1953, marked the first centenary of the Indian Railways. In 1853 the first rails were laid between Bombay and Thana. Where once only the hoof-beat of the bullock or pony could be heard, the iron horse now thunders. India now possesses the largest railway system in Asia and the third largest in the world. Commentary by Berkeley Hill.
results.creator_credit_for_label: M. Bhavnani, Documentary Films of India and V.R. Sarma

results.title: Centripetal force and satellite orbits
results.brief_description: Demonstrates how mass, velocity and radius affect the magnitude of centripetal force. States this effect in equation form and solves a problem involving the velocity needed to hold a satellite in orbit. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Centre stage = Center stage (Collector's edition)
results.creator_credit: Laurence Mark, Columbia Pictures Corporation and Nicholas Hytner
results.brief_description: In this teen ensemble drama, the fortunes of several young ambitious dancers are determined over one year’s tuition in a prestigious New York dance school, as they compete for just a few contested places. Jody is the sweet natured ingenue outclassed by the elite students of the school; Maureen is the child protegee dealing with bulimia and a domineering stage mum; Eva is the African-American rebel seeking validation from her peers. The students struggle with the demands of the school and their personal relationships that at times threaten to thwart the achievement of their exacting goal. Most characters are drawn from stock stereotypes (from the “Fame” repertoire), but the drama is affective in its evocation of the young protagonists’ qualms about their uncertain future. Real dancers play most of the main characters, which explains some of the wooden acting, and although the narrative progression is far from unpredictable, the dance sequences are quite stunning and fun to watch. The narrative also touches on body image among female dancers and old style choreography and teaching methods, versus a modern approach. Cast includes: Amanda Schullm, Zoe Saldana, Susan May Pratt, Donna Murphy, Debra Monk, Ethan Stiefel, Sascha Radetsky.

results.title: Central Asia: crossroads of culture
results.creator_credit: Tashkent Film Studios and M Raioumov
results.brief_description: In the heart of Asia can be seen traces of a great civilization. The Central Asian region formed part of the Kisham Empire, comparable in greatness with that of the Romans. This film shows the relatively unknown cultural heritage of Central Asia. Made in co-operation with UNESCO and with the assistance of the National Commissions for UNESCO of Afghanistan, India, Iran, Pakistan and the USSR.

results.title: Central America (Caribbean region II)
results.brief_description: The climate, geography, economic interdependence on the rest of the world, the industries, and the peoples of Central America, are studied briefly in this film. The region’s position and importance in the Carribbean area, and its political history from the time of Columbus to the present, are sketched with the aid of animated diagrams.

results.title: Central America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Geography of the Americas”.
Describes the three main topographical regions of Central America - hot lowlands, temperate plateau, and cool mountain lands. Shows effects of climate on inhabitants and crops. Shows how coffee is grown and shipped. Discusses the economic importance of the Panama Canal.
